sec.p: The leaf, stem and root of E. foetidum were collected from mature plants cultivated in Uyo Local Government Area of Akwa Ibom State, Nigeria, in the month of May 2016. The Sample was identified by a taxonomist in the Department of Botany and Ecological Studies, University of Uyo, where voucher specimen was deposited. The essential oils were obtained by hydrodistillation (4 h) of the fresh plant parts using a Clevenger-type apparatus in accordance with the British Pharmacopoeia [ 18]. The oils were dried over sodium sulfate and stored in refrigeration (4 Â°C) after estimation of percentage yield.
